column5: The wife would like to try them if you have a few to go. Joe
I have 5 or 6lbs of ground moose meat I'm bringing, should make for a couple of good meat loaves or perhaps burgers.
You are the Best!! thanks Joe!
just reading this thread and sounds like one fantastic time.   I wish I could be there too,  but maybe another year? Hope the weather and fish cooperate.    Enjoy!

Ten years ago, at the first Lakair get together, it rained nonstop the entire weekend and it was one of the best get togethers yet. A positive attitude, a good bunch of friends and you can have a great time no matter where you are or what the weather brings.
Spiel I'm thinking chilli See you in the morning !!
I wish I didn't have to work in the morning!
Ditto Dan  Will probably be the longest day of my life
Head'n down for some snooze time Chris. We'll see you in the morning.

Those of you who haven't left yet, please drive safely. I have a 12 hour work day ahead of me then the 8+ hour drive to Lakair with boat in tow. Looking forward to seeing you all and meeting some new members.
See ya there :)  :)
Man... Wish I was going on this trip... Sounds like a hoot. My trip same time frame, but south shore of the Nip. Good luck to all.
Good luck to all who are attending, please have a safe and fun trip! Looking forward to reading the numerous reports in a week

I hope everyone has a safe trip, also hope everyone dose well on the water. I'm am however envious of each of you folks. I have traveled all over the US, and I have to say that the Nipissing area is the most beautiful land I have ever had the pleasure of stepping foot on. Maybe next year if you folks would have us the Wife and I might make it.  Jeff
I hope to see a lot of pictures as well.  Jeff
Sorry, just went through the camera and I can't post any of the pics!
truer words have not been spoken!
I got some stuff for the prize table as well...

Ya.. just so were clear, same routine as always, Saturday Morning 11-2 is the tourney 2-3 fish cleaning 3-5 or so prizes, and after 5 FISH fry , with pot luck sides. then campfires and drinks! I have a few prizes, but everyone should bring a little something!
Yeah, I always bring a little something with me....I have a few prizes too...........

Looks like the weather is going to be awesome, 29 on Friday and 30 on Saturday, with trace rain and lots of sun.  So bring your bathing suits and don't stand near the end of the dock, right DouG  Joey
Gee, that sounds like an invitation to me....  THREE more sleeps.
Bring it on ... 3 more sleeps.  (of course, the last night don't count)
Well be sure to pop the top... so I can see the runway lights as I'm coming in over the bridge.....
Hahahahaa!   :rofl2:
Just in case Joeys not their How rr you at landing by moonlight???  Art
I've done that before too Art.... lol
Hey Plummas, you bringing some extra tins of that tasty fish batter up again?  I'll buy one off ya!  Joey
There will be some coming your way Joey.That and some alpaca hair. Joe
Some o dat 100% deet would be very nice, put me down for 4 bottles.  Pssssssssst, keep this on the downlow.
funny I Pm'd them the same thing! that and some cookie crisp!
Ughhh... bad day..  My GF's oldest son was suspended from school today, for a Bull reason.. needless to say we are bringing him with us.. anyone else going to have kids around?

Anything you boys from the Southern contingent need from up our way that you might not have time to pick up? Let me know and I'll deliver it Saturday morning. (already got those puff balls packed Joe). Hey, any of you guys ever tried pickled leeks?
No but I would love to try them Cliff! Anything pickled is AOK in my books!!!
I have Cookie Crisps,Deet and fish fry loaded up.See some of y'all tomorrow and the rest the next day. Joe
Have a safe drive Joe !! Keep that Art fella awake and watching for transient deer !
Have a safe trip guys, see you Thursday.
Safe travels guys.   Give a toot as you pass through the southern part of PA.  If you're coming through Breezewood or Beford, I'm less than an hour away.
Should be going by there around 9:00 or so on the way to Spiels place.If Art toots you will smell it.Dont forget to bring your  Pups! Joe
If we see any transient ones they will become dinner deer!Its Arts truck but I might be driving it.
Eh! Capt !!! Ya still got room for a 30' camper?  I'll call ya tomorrow.  Randy
Me and the family will be at the same cottage as last year (#5A) playing darts.  Maybe if we are lucky this year we might even try not too sleep through the presentation.  See you all then

Hi every body. If there is any of yous who would like bait but do not wish to haul it up with you.  I will be there on Thursday and i set it up with my friend who owns a bait and tackle shop, Just call him or e-mail him and he will get it ready and i will pick it up and bring it for payment you can ether pay for it when you order or we can make some kind of arrangement,just let me know  phon #(705)674-6113 	fax # (705)674-7915  e-mail,- [email protected] 	or [email protected]   it is only 45 min for me so it will not be a problem

I was wondering how that worked out for you? Did you get the starter fixed? I got thinking after you left that we should have pulled it apart, it might have only needed a new set of brushes. Also, was I right about the output from the charging coil? A schematic would have sure simplified things.  Lastly, where I told you to put that grommet. If you are having trouble finding one to fit, just take a piece of fuel line, cut it lengthways down one side and that will do the trick. Let me know if you need some, I'll bring it up to Lakair and drop it off when I make my quick appearance on the Saturday.

Saddly work is getting in the way and Sue and I can't make it for the weekend. I am going to drive up on the Friday right after I get off work, spend the night at my daughters Friday night, be at the camp bright and early Saturday morning but I'll have to leave early Saturday afternoon.
Ahem,
Yes the fireban was lifted in the North Joey! Currently at Moderate caution...
Thanks Hun.  Hope Kev has stocked up on wood
Anyone know if Breakfast is still 5 bux? I know the camping price went up this year.. and I am trying to figure out how much cash I need on hand.  Thanks!  G

Whats the program for this year?  are we doing a pot luck/pike fry on saturday?  if we are doing the pot luck, miss kelly will make her pot of chili again. (and joey will make paul sleep in the dining tent again)

I certainly hope so.  Saturday is a great fun-filled day and loads of good company and a little Bull on the side.  Don't forget to bring some things along to sweeten the prize table.   That's on my list of things to do today.  Fishing stuff shopping.  Now that's the stuff
Me thinks this is the year the trophy goes south of the border.  We have a number of boys from down here heading up "on a mission"
Sorry Rich, but it's got a home on my mantle!

No problem Dan.  Uh ... just be sure to bring the mantle with you.  I'll need something to set it on.  Who knows - it may just end up in Virginia ... ya just never know.  Looking forward to saying Hello - sounds like I'll have the opportunity to meet some more new OFC'rs this yeear.
I believe it was $8.00 last year Gerritt
Good to know thanks John!
Slowpoke and I will be arriving on Friday morning, and bunking with the Plummas.  A gallon and a half of the best baked beans will be arriving at pretty much the same time.  Give or take.
does any one know what time you can check in on thursday and get the tent set up thanks
There are no set rules for camping.....just be there....we'll fix it.  Looking forward to meeting you.
thanks for quick reply roy
I am pretty sure that the trophy wants to spend some time in the South soaking up the sun......  Art

Spoke to Kevin a few moments ago, as I needed to change plans.. I plan on coming up Thursday Evening now  and have asked for the site where the old Shed is.. (you know.. the one the dock hand used to sleep in lol by the outhouses)  Anyways he informed me the fire ban is off... so it looks like we can see TJ firewalk after all!  Ohhh and just so you know.. My girlfriend has informed me she is going to kick all our butts! She is claiming the trophy as her own..  ahhhh beginner ambition..  G
Well if she can put up with you G... I'm sure she CAN kick all our butts ! lol
Art, if I get the right fish, I will be sure to claim that one of the Plummas caught it.  I got yer back.
You da man!

Maybe you could sticky this Roy???  Barbara and I are trying to get last minute accomodation and if successful we will be there with Big Cliff and his lovely lady Sue.  Hopefully we will see all ya'all in a couple of weeks.  J...
Damn, you're fast!.....
Patsy and I hope you're successful.   (crossing our fingers).
Looks like we will be there Rich. Looking forward to it.

Talked to Kevin this morning. Says that water level verrrrrry low, no surprise. Launch still has lots of water. Docks are being modified but some are unusable. He did say that fishing has been good! I know, I know, they all say that....

Restricted fire zone remains in effect.  Please remember that while this lasts we allow no fires in our camp grounds. Period!  Be perpared to bring propane stoves to cook on.  Hopefully we will get some rain before the OFC weekend and this will not be an issue, but its best to be perpared for the a continuation of the fire ban.  Already today there are 3 new fires in the area and it's not even 11:am yet.   the cap't
Well I am in Confirmed this morning  It will my Girlfriend and myself...  Looking forward to it... it has been a couple of years!!!  G
miss kelly & I will be there!!  with my    electric    start boat thanks for all your help big cliff.....
Hey Cap't, did you get enough rain to lift the fire ban?
You got a chiminea to bring with you....
Someone needs to bring one of those electric ones ... like ya can put in your fire place.
If we pile enough wood on Joey's fire pit, I'm sure there'll be a lightning hit in the early evening...we should be able to get it extinguished by 1am or so.
As you all know the Southern Contingency power of 2 will be their from Thursday till Sunday.   Art and Joe
And the most welcome contingency it is as well! Looking forward to seeing you guys. It's been a year now and I'm starting to lose my Cajun accent.
Im looking forward to seeing everyone as well!!
Yes but the Southern Contingency of 2 will be at my house on the Wednesday for the night. Looking forward to that, then Lakair with the old Muskiestudd on Friday.
Shorty and my self will try to be there
Funny you mention that Roy,I've aboot lost me Canadian accent ,eh? Joe
went there today and reserved my spot thursday to Sunday. Can't wait
Hi there,  would it be too late to join for this event? Would accomadations be available still?  Thanks
Give them a call, Tristar. Even if they have nothing, we always manage to find space for everyone
Sorry my friends but I will not be able to make it this year... My 32nd anniversary on the Thursday and my mothers 79th birthday on Sunday... I think I could be dead if I am not around...
Sorry we will miss you too Kelvin. Solve the problem like I did, bring the girls with you. It's my 36th wedding anniversary on the 21st.
Already thought of that with the wife... No Go as for Mom... To far to travel..
Has douG cofirmed with anyone? Joe
So it's getting to be that time again. I'm really looking forward to it. Will the dudes making the trip please post here so that we know how many will be there? I'll bump the thread as needed.
Was booked, had to cancel  - 1

Patsy and I will be there - along with our two 4-legged girls. COUNT (2). Cabin #5.  Just out from the lodge.  Arriving late Thursday afternoon the 17th - Leaving Saturday the 26th. Gonna take in a good week of musky fishing while we are there.  Catching - well that be another story that has yet to be told.

The good lord willing I will be making an appearance for a while but I will be staying at my son's (we might even get into and win the fishing derby)  I really want a chance to get to see many of my old friends and finally get to meet the boys from down South (I have some dehydrated puffball mushrooms for someone  )
Count me in
Well Roy.. you know where I'm still stuck ! Recession my ass...  MIGHT drop in from the sky if we can s'wing it..
As I mentioned previously, I'll unfortunately be missing this years G2G seeing as were gonna be there the following week.  Have a blast though guys !!
We'll be there, probably the Friday, staying a full week.  Will you be there that week Lew?  Joey
I don't think so Joey, the week Lew is referring to is July 3-10
Come in from the west, that 64 bridge is pretty low
With the water down, Brian, I can get under it if I don't bounce!!
Fair enough. Umm does Spiel fix wing tips? It might be a tad narrow.
I only need 30 feet. 2 inches.. and a bit of wiggle room! lol
I will be the camera man   but on the ground shooting it
Who are you zoomin'?You cant even get yer fatass boat thru without snippin the tops of yer rods off. Joe We do have a spot on the boat if ya come down though.
So this is a dare now right?
Thanks Joe.. great to have friends with boats! lol.. How we met.
My wife and I will be there Thursday to Sunday, cottage #9 I think.
i will be there thursday till sunday see you all there
seeing if I can get something worked out....
Ill be there with wifey and kids thursday to sun.
Rick and I will be there Thurs to Sun

Not sure of the g2g dates this year Joey but it sounds like you may be heading home the day before we arrive.  Sorry were gonna miss you & Paul, but leave a couple of those big slimers in the lake for me, will ya please ??
I hope to pop in at least one if not two days that week...  Maureen

I'll be there the weekend before your group.  We'll find some fish and will share advice if you send me a private message. Hopefully I can post a trophy pike photo or two to get the group even more primed.
